title: High Adequacy of Social Protection Programs
description: In 2018, Laos achieved a high adequacy rate of 90.86% for its social protection and labor programs, indicating strong welfare support for beneficiary households.

title: Low Net Official Flows from UN Agencies
description: In 2022, Laos received one of the lowest net official flows from UN agencies, with a total of $100,406.89 from the World Food Programme.

title: Minimal Financial Intermediary Services
description: In 2015, Laos recorded a minimal value of 100 in its Financial Intermediary Services Indirectly Measured, indicating limited financial service activities.

title: High Learning Poverty Among Male Pupils
description: In 2019, 98.13% of male pupils in Laos were below the minimum reading proficiency at the end of primary school, highlighting significant educational challenges.

title: High Learning Poverty Among Female Pupils
description: In 2019, 97.01% of female pupils in Laos were below the minimum reading proficiency at the end of primary school, indicating a critical need for educational improvements.

title: Negative Electricity Production from Renewables
description: In 2021, Laos reported a negative electricity production of -4,489,800,000 kWh from renewable sources, excluding hydroelectric, suggesting challenges in sustainable energy generation.
